thread.title: GreenSlate Hires Marcella Andre as Vice President of Sales & New Business Development

author: cnbc.com
title: GreenSlate Hires Marcella Andre as Vice President of Sales & New Business Development
text:
NEW YORK, March 14, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- GreenSlate ( www.gslate.com ), the nationally acclaimed entertainment payroll and business services company that supports global franchises, independent storytellers, and award-winning productions, announced today that it has hired Marcella Andre as Vice President of Sales & New Business Development.
"We couldn't be happier to have Marcella on the GreenSlate team—her insight and knowledge of our business is well-known among producers, production accountants, and virtually every member of the production office," said Paul Cosentino, EVP of Sales & New Business Development. "Having the right people is a key element of our success, and Marcella is a prime example. Clients love her passion and ingenuity, which are both hallmarks of the GreenSlate brand."
Marcella has a highly successful track record in the entertainment payroll industry, having worked with nearly every provider in the business, including Entertainment Partners, CAPS, and Cast & Crew. Over the last 12 years, she has played a critical role in introducing new technology to content producers who are some of the most well-known players in media today, such as Netflix, HBO, NBC Universal, Disney-ABC, AETN, Radical Media, Lucky 8 TV, Zero Point Zero Productions, and Black Label Media, as well as hundreds of commercial and independent producers. Marcella started her career in the music business, serving as Director of A&R at Columbia Records, and later as Vice President of A&R and Soundtracks at Def Jam Records. In her new position, she will be based in New York and will also manage strategic relationships in Los Angeles and Atlanta.
"Producers in the field are hungry for digital solutions that make their lives easier and the crew happier, which is why GreenSlate is the place to be," Marcella said. "I'm thrilled to be a part of a dynamic and growing company that is clearly leading the charge to give productions the all-digital future they deserve, while helping to bring sustainability to the fore."
Beyond hiring notable new staff like Marcella Andre, GreenSlate has been aggressively expanding its footprint nationwide, most recently with a new office in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
About GreenSlate
Leveraging two decades of experience in the entertainment industry, GreenSlate advances the business of content production by seamlessly integrating people, processes, and technology to meet the essential business needs of content producers. GreenSlate supports global franchises, independent storytellers, and award-winning productions, with clients including Oscar 2018's Best Supporting Actress Winner "I, Tonya," Oscar 2017's Best Picture Winner "Moonlight," TBS's "Search Party," Comedy Central's "Broad City," and many more.
Simplifying what shouldn't be complicated, GreenSlate has built the industry's most intuitive production accounting software, paperless payroll processing, and digital workflow solutions, with more innovative applications and products on the way. From budget to delivery, GreenSlate's technology, tax management, and benefits services enable production teams to focus more on what they do best—creating inspiring content.
For more information, visit www.gslate.com .
